issues.description: The problem statement instructs students to access the children list via a public field (`person.children`), but in both the template and solution `Person.java`, the `children` field is declared private and only exposed via a getter. Students will be unable to follow the instruction to access the field directly.
issues.suggested_fix: Either make the `children` field public in `Person.java` so it can be accessed directly as described, or update the problem statement to instruct students to use the `getChildren()` method instead of direct field access.

issues.description: The problem statement specifies API endpoints with the `/api` prefix (e.g., `PUT /api/persons/{personId}/parents`), but the controller mappings in the starter code define these endpoints without `/api` (e.g., `@PutMapping("persons/{personId}/parents")`). This mismatch between the documented paths and actual mappings can confuse students when testing or calling the endpoints.
issues.suggested_fix: Either remove the `/api` prefix from all endpoint examples in the problem statement or add it to the controller mappings. For example, annotate the class with `@RequestMapping(path = "/api", consumes = ..., produces = ...)` so that `@PutMapping("persons/{personId}/parents")` becomes available at `/api/persons/{personId}/parents`.
